text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    1900 - 0700

        CODE status: 
Full Code / Full Resuscitative Efforts 

    Patient identification is confirmed by an accurate secured armband
         YES

    Are restraints in use? 
         No.

    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No

BED BUG ASSESSMENT: 
Patient has been assessed for the presence of bed bugs and/or bed bug bites. No 
evidence of bed bugs noted.

PATIENT EDUCATION
   BARRIERS TO LEARNING
   Patient:  No observed barriers to learning 

   Information Taught:  plan of care, course of antibiotics

   To Whom: Patient
 
   Method:  verbal, handout 
 
   Learner Response:  Indicates Understanding 
 

PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
   CARING/HEALING PRACTICE
Presenting Needs/Symptoms
Nausea/Vomiting
INTERVENTION:  Other: antibiotics
        Comments:
CARATIVE FACTORS
My respect for this patient allowed me to be availabe to him/her. 
I paused to listen.
By listening, I was able to honor this patient's belief system and enable 
him/her to feel his own sense of faith/hope.
By centering before going into this patient's room, I allowed my self 
to be open to all of him/her
By being more responsive to the patient's needs and feelings, I was able
to create a more trusting relationship.
The caring relationship in a caring environment promoted spiritual growth
Exercised patient-centered problem solving and scholarship in caring for 
this patient
The caring relationship I promoted promotes knowledge, growth,
empowerment and healing processes and possibilities for the patient 
and for me
By promoting the caring relationship I created space for this patient to 
generate his own wholeness and healing
I was able to help meet the needs this patient identified for him/herself
Caring calls for advanced competency and skill in authentically engaging 
in caring for patients.  This engagement can be translated into advanced caring 
- healing modalities.
Patient Outcomes:   pt is tolerating diet well. no nausea or vomiting.


GENITOURINARY 
Voiding without difficulty, Using BR/hat, Urine color (specify):  amber/clear

IV ACCESS
INTRAVENOUS ACCESS NOTE

IV SITE & DRESSING ASSESSMENT
  Type 
   Peripheral IV 
     Size:20#
  Catheter and insertion site assessment: 
     Location:R Hand 
     Date placed:May 30,2012
Each needleless connector either had a green alcohol cap 
    Inspection of site shows: 
      clear with no symptoms of infection, phlebitis or infiltration, flushes 
easily
    Action take if other than clear:
  Dressing assessment:
        Date Dressing Changed:  May 30,2012 
        Dressing change not indicated.
text.author: NURSE,TWENTY-SEVEN
